channel.title: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
channel.description:
To save myself, some typing, here's my post from [url='https://facepunch.com/showthread.php?t=1152082&p=37777873&viewfull=1#post37777873']Facepunch[/url]: [quote] So I was messing around in Black Mesa making NPC battles when I discovered that I could arm the scientists with weapons. Turns out that if you give them something to fight with, the normally meek scientists become effective fighters. Guess there's a Gordon Freeman in everybody. ![](upload://10lfuAjPuhJv5cgOu0mezdifJ4o.jpeg) ![](upload://4F75uRa7LYed6zY90S5K1IPVb81.jpeg) ![](upload://nehUcaOIOnDxTKNnIDMvm7HrFtK.jpeg) ![](upload://iZIuouWN2MmVUukBWBjdynv1aGT.jpeg) For best results, equip them with the MP5. It works with other weapons, but I notice they're a bit more hesitant to use them. I'm not sure if you can give them firepower with "npc_create_equipment", but what I did was:
[b]ent_fire !picker giveweapon weapon_weaponnamehere[/b]
And when using "ent_fire !picker", make sure your crosshair is aimed on the NPC you wish to give the weapon to.
Enjoy your squad of super geniuses. [/quote] Hope you guys have fun with this!

item.title: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
item.dc:creator: Crypt
item.description:
You now know why BMDM isn’t out.

Read full topic
item.source: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)

item.title: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
item.dc:creator: Pettifogg
item.description:
Protip: if you type in the npc name rather than “!picker” it arms all of them. So putting “ent_fire npc_human_scientist giveweapon weapon_shotgun” into the console gives every scientist on the map a shotgun.

Vertigo:

There is, it’s just that like all of the non-standard weapons (except the crowbar!) it doesn’t quite connect to the character properly. It looks better than the hive hand - which for some reason seems to be a genitally-operated weapon for non-Gordonites - but the clipping’s more noticeable than with the gauss gun.

Hopefully this will be fixed with Deathmatch?

Read full topic
item.source: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)

item.source: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)

item.title: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
item.dc:creator: Malidictus
item.description:
Actually, I wouldn’t mind of scientists and guards started picking up weapons off the ground like I suggested elsewhere. If the AI for them to use those guns is still there, I’d love to see it. I get that they’re supposed to be meek and helpless, but hey - Gordon basically inspired open rebellion against the Combine, and he never opened his mouth. Surely he can inspire Dr. Kleiner to pick up a shotgun and protect himself

Honestly, it might make some of the jock humour much more tolerable if the scientists aren’t such panzies.

Read full topic
item.source: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)

item.title: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
item.dc:creator: snake-4c-merc
item.description:
To save myself, some typing, here’s my post from Facepunch:

So I was messing around in Black Mesa making NPC battles when I discovered that I could arm the scientists with weapons. Turns out that if you give them something to fight with, the normally meek scientists become effective fighters. Guess there’s a Gordon Freeman in everybody.




For best results, equip them with the MP5. It works with other weapons, but I notice they’re a bit more hesitant to use them. I’m not sure if you can give them firepower with “npc_create_equipment”, but what I did was:

ent_fire !picker giveweapon weapon_weaponnamehere

And when using “ent_fire !picker”, make sure your crosshair is aimed on the NPC you wish to give the weapon to.

Enjoy your squad of super geniuses.

Hope you guys have fun with this!

Read full topic
item.source: Give the brains some brawn! (Scientist trick)
